intro: Hedyotis ternata, commonly known as smallleaf knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, white or pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Hedyotis ternata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along streambanks.
